1 ''' custom graph-like objects defined here. import class methods are
2  :SquareGrid:
3  :neighbors(v): given tuple (x,y), returns neighbors
4  :cost(v1, v2): given two tuples (v1, v2), returns cost of edge
5 
6  :MyGraph: User can define a generic graph, by giving a edge list
7  :neighbors(v): similar to above, but v is generic here
8  :cost(v1,v2): similar to above, but v1,v2 is generic
9 '''
10 
11 import numpy as np
12 
13 from .grid_utils import init_grid
14 from .grid_utils import get_index
15 from .grid_utils import get_world
16 
17 import pdb
18 class SquareGrid:
19  def __init__(self, grid, grid_dim, grid_size, type_=4):
20  self.xwidth = grid_dim[1] - grid_dim[0]
21  self.yheight = grid_dim[3] - grid_dim[2]
22  #Initialize grid if nothing is passed in
23  if np.size(grid) != 0:
24  self.grid = grid
25  else:
26  self.grid = init_grid(grid_dim, grid_size, 0)
27  self.grid_dim = grid_dim
28  self.grid_size = grid_size
29  self.neighbor_type = type_
30 
31  def in_bounds(self, ind, type_='map'):
32  if type_ == 'world':
33  (x, y) = ind
34  return self.grid_dim[0] <= x <= self.grid_dim[1] and self.grid_dim[2] <= y <= self.grid_dim[3]
35  else:
36  # grid indices
37  (indx, indy) = ind
38  xcells = int(np.ceil((self.xwidth + 1) / self.grid_size))
39  ycells = int(np.ceil((self.yheight + 1) / self.grid_size))
40  return 0 <= indx <= xcells and 0 <= indy <= ycells
41 
42  def not_obstacles(self, ind, type_='map'):
43  if type_ == 'map':
44  (indx, indy) = ind
45  # may have issues in the future...
46  return self.grid[indy, indx] == 0
47  else:
48  # convert world to ind first
49  (indx, indy) = get_index(ind[0], ind[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
50  return self.grid[indy, indx] == 0
51 
52  def neighbors(self, xxx_todo_changeme):
53  ''' modified to do less converting, stay in world frame'''
54  # Convert world coordinates to indices
55  # (x, y) = xxx_todo_changeme
56  # (indx, indy) = get_index(x, y, self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
57  # (indx, indy) = xxx_todo_changeme
58  # if self.neighbor_type == 4:
59  # results = [(indx + 1, indy), (indx, indy - 1),
60  # (indx - 1, indy), (indx, indy + 1)]
61  # elif self.neighbor_type == 8:
62  # results = [(indx + 1, indy), (indx, indy - 1),
63  # (indx - 1, indy), (indx, indy + 1),
64  # (indx + 1, indy + 1), (indx + 1, indy - 1),
65  # (indx - 1, indy - 1), (indx - 1, indy + 1)]
66 
67  (x, y) = xxx_todo_changeme
68  if self.neighbor_type == 4:
69  results = [(x + self.grid_size, y), (x, y - self.grid_size),
70  (x - self.grid_size, y), (x, y + self.grid_size)]
71  elif self.neighbor_type == 8:
72  results = [(x + self.grid_size, y), (x, y - self.grid_size),
73  (x - self.grid_size, y), (x, y + self.grid_size),
74  (x + self.grid_size, y + self.grid_size), (x + self.grid_size, y - self.grid_size),
75  (x - self.grid_size, y - self.grid_size), (x - self.grid_size, y + self.grid_size)]
76 
77 
78  # Only return coordinates that are in range
79  results = filter(lambda x: self.in_bounds(x, type_='world'), results)
80 
81  # Only return coordinates that are not obstacles
82  results = filter(lambda x: self.not_obstacles(x, type_='world'), results)
83 
84 
92  return results
93 
94  # Cost of moving from one node to another (edge cost)
95  def cost(self, from_node, to_node):
96  a = from_node
97  b = to_node
98  v = (b[0] - a[0], b[1] - a[1])
99  return np.hypot(v[0], v[1])
100 
101 class MyGraph:
102  def __init__(self, edge_dict, allow_cycles=True):
103  '''edge_dict: is dict containing all edges and weights
104  {('v1', 'v2'): 5.0}
105 
106  edges = [('v1', 'v2'), ('v1','v3')]
107  weights = [0.5, 0.4]
108 
109  g = MyGraph()
110  '''
111  # TODO Consider creating an adjaceny list, to make finding neighbors faster
112  self.edge_dict = edge_dict
113 
114  def update(self, edge_dict):
115  self.edge_dict.update(edge_dict)
116 
117  def remove(self, edge_dict):
118  for e in edge_dict.keys():
119  self.edge_dict.pop(e)
120 
121  '''neighbors returns a list [] '''
122  def neighbors(self, v):
123  # Create a list of edges containing v
124  edgeList = [key for key, val in self.edge_dict.items() if v in key]
125 
126  # Go through each tuple in test2 and select neighbors
127  neighs = [node for edge in edgeList for node in edge if node != v]
128 
129  # remove duplicates by creating a dictionary
130  neighs = list(dict.fromkeys(neighs))
131 
132  return neighs
133 
134  ''' cost returns edge weight '''
135  def cost(self, from_node, to_node):
136  weight = self.edge_dict[(from_node, to_node)]
137  return weight
